column2: WISCONSIN DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Wisconsin
column6: WI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column6: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.
column8: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column10: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.

column2: 2. A flashing red light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 3. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column4: black
column6: white
column8: yellow

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Highway entrance ramp ahead
column6: The left lane ends soon
column8: The right lane ends soon

column2: 5. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column6: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column8: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 7. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: stop and wait for the light to change.
column8: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column10: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.

column2: 8. If you need to make an emergency stop:
column4: sound your horn at passing vehicles to alert other drivers.
column6: turn on your emergency flashers and stay in your vehicle if safe.
column8: get out of the vehicle once you have stopped.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead
column6: Two-way traffic ahead
column8: No right turn

column2: 10. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column6: honk your horn.
column8: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
column10: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.

column2: 11. This sign indicates that:
column4: there's a side road ahead
column6: there are trucks on the hill.
column8: there is a steep hill ahead.
column10: trucks are merging from the right

column2: 12. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column6: buckled up in the back seat.
column8: buckled up in the front seat.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: No stopping
column6: No left turn
column8: No Turning

column2: 14. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 15. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.

column2: 16. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
column6: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column8: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: road construction.
column6: divided highway ahead.
column8: lane ends, merge left.

column2: 18. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to look for road edge markings to guide you.
column6: to turn on your headlights.
column8: to reduce your speed.
column10: to turn on your windshield wipers.

column2: 19. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 20. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 21. This sign indicates:
column4: a no passing zone.
column6: a church zone ahead.
column8: a cross road.

column2: 22. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: must yield the right-of-way.
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column8: have no driving errors.

column2: 23. It is illegal to park within _____ feet of a fire hydrant.
24. This sign means:
column4: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 25. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column6: You continue to yawn.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No U-Turn
column8: Do not enter

column2: 27. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles are slower than cars.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 28. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 29. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 30. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column8: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.

column2: 31. You need extra following distance when:
column4: following a motorcycle.
column6: there are no vehicles behind you.
column8: following a passenger car.

column2: 32. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column6: talk on your cell phone while driving.
column8: always signal your intention when changing lanes.

column2: 33. When changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
column6: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column8: slow down and check your left mirror.

column2: 34. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column4: be ready to stop.
column6: look for a train.
column8: slow down.

column2: 35. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Pumping brakes.
column6: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column8: Air bag only

column2: 36. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column6: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 37. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Reaction distance.
column6: Steering ability.
column8: Perception time.

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 39. Speed limit signs are:
column4: destination signs (guide signs)
column6: regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: warning signs

column2: 40. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving
column6: furious driving
column8: road rage

column2: 41. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: Pedestrians may turn right.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 42. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column6: No right turn
column8: You must turn right

column2: 43. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column10: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 44. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column4: the driver
column6: whoever is slower
column8: the pedestrian

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No left turn
column8: No U-turns

column2: 46. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column6: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column8: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.

column2: 47. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 48. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column10: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 49. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way
column6: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching
column8: You have the right of way

column2: 50. This road sign means:
column4: Construction zone ahead
column6: School zone ahead
column8: Sharp turn, slow down
